intro: Nauclea transversa, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
